name: src/SerenityReporterForJasmine.ts
SerenityReporterForJasmine
description:
[Jasmine reporter](https://jasmine.github.io/tutorials/custom_reporter) that translates Jasmine-specific test events
 to Serenity/JS events.

name: repairedStackTraceOf
description:
It seems like Jasmine mixes up serialisation and display logic,
which means that its "failure.stack" is not really an Error stacktrace,
but rather something along the lines of:
"error properties: AssertionError: undefined"
where the error message is lost, and there's an "error properties:" prefix present.

Probably caused by this:
https://github.com/jasmine/jasmine/blob/b4cbe9850fbe192eaffeae450669f96e79a574ed/src/core/ExceptionFormatter.js#L93

name: src/adapter/JasmineAdapter.ts
JasmineAdapter
description:
Allows for programmatic execution of Jasmine test scenarios,
 using {@link SerenityReporterForJasmine} to report progress.

name: src/adapter/JasmineConfig.ts
JasmineConfig
description: Configuration object that will be passed to the JasmineRunner.

name: helpers
description:
A list of paths to helper files that should be loaded and executed before the `requires` and the `specs`.
 Accepts relative and absolute paths as well as glob expressions.

name: requires
description:
A list of paths to files that should be required after the `helpers`, but before the `specs`.
 The path need to be compatible with Node {@link require}.

name: random
description: Whether or not the tests should be executed in a pseudo-random order.

name: grep
description: Used to exclude any test scenarios which name doesn't match the pattern from the run.

name: seed
description:
The randomisation seed that will be used to determine the pseudo-random order of execution,
 if `random` is set to `true`

name: defaultTimeoutInterval
description:
Sets the global `jasmine.DEFAULT_TIMEOUT_INTERVAL`,
 which defines the default number of milliseconds Jasmine will wait for an asynchronous spec to complete.

name: src/adapter/index.ts
content:
export * from './JasmineAdapter';
export * from './JasmineConfig';

name: src/bootstrap.ts
bootstrap
description:
Monkey-patches Jasmine's Suite and Spec so that they provide more accurate information and
 returns a bootstrapped instance of the {@link SerenityReporterForJasmine} to be registered with Jasmine.
examples:
<caption>Registering the reporter from the command line</caption>
jasmine --reporter=@serenity-js/jasmine

<caption>Registering the reporter programmatically</caption>
import serenityReporterForJasmine = require('@serenity-js/jasmine');

jasmine.getEnv().addReporter(serenityReporterForJasmine);

name: src/index.ts
content:
import { bootstrap } from './bootstrap';

export = bootstrap;

name: src/jasmine/Expectation.ts
matcherName
description: The name of the matcher that was executed for this expectation.

name: message
description: The failure message for the expectation.

name: stack
description: The stack trace for the failure if available.

name: passed
description: Whether the expectation passed or failed.

name: expected
description: If the expectation failed, what was the expected value.

name: actual
description: If the expectation failed, what actual value was produced.

name: src/jasmine/JasmineDoneInfo.ts
JasmineDoneInfo
description: Information passed to the Reporter#jasmineDone event.

name: overallStatus
description: The overall result of the suite: 'passed', 'failed', or 'incomplete'.

name: incompleteReason
description: Explanation of why the suite was incomplete.

name: order
description: Information about the ordering (random or not) of this execution of the suite.

name: failedExpectations
description: List of expectations that failed in an afterAll at the global level.

name: deprecationWarnings
description: List of deprecation warnings that occurred at the global level.

name: src/jasmine/JasmineStartedInfo.ts
JasmineStartedInfo
description: Information passed to the Reporter#jasmineStarted event.

name: totalSpecsDefined
description: The total number of specs defined in this suite.

name: order
description: Information about the ordering (random or not) of this execution of the suite.

name: src/jasmine/Location.ts
Location
description: A Serenity/JS-specific customisation - the file system location of the caller of a given `it` and `describe` function.

name: src/jasmine/Order.ts
Order
description: Information about the ordering (random or not) of this execution of the suite.

name: src/jasmine/Result.ts
src/jasmine/SpecResult.ts
src/jasmine/SuiteResult.ts
id
description: The unique id of this suite.

name: description
description: The description text passed to the `describe` that made this suite.

name: fullName
description: The full description including all ancestors of this suite.

name: failedExpectations
description: The list of expectations that failed in an afterAll for this suite.

name: deprecationWarnings
description: The list of deprecation warnings that occurred on this suite.

name: status
description: Once the suite has completed, this string represents the pass/fail status of this suite.

name: duration
description: The time in ms for Suite execution, including any before/afterAll, before/afterEach.

name: src/jasmine/index.ts
src/monkeyPatched.ts
monkeyPatched
description:
Monkey-patches Jasmine domain model constructors so that they
 record information about the file system location of the caller function.

 This helps to make reporting more accurate.

params.name: jasmineConstructor
params.description: A Jasmine constructor function to be patched

params.name: wrappers
params.description: Attributes to wrap when the monkey-patched Jasmine constructor is invoked

name: callerLocation
description: Retrieves the file system location of the caller function.

name: isAStaticProperty
description: Checks if a given property is likely to be a static method or a static field on the constructor function.

params.name: property
params.description: name of the property to be checked

content:
# Serenity/JS

[Serenity/JS](https://serenity-js.org) is a Node.js library designed to make acceptance and regression testing
of modern full-stack applications faster, more collaborative and easier to scale.

## Serenity/JS Jasmine

The `@serenity-js/jasmine` module contains a [Jasmine reporter](https://jasmine.github.io/api/edge/Reporter.html)
that can be registered with the [Jasmine test runner](https://jasmine.github.io/)
to enable integration between Jasmine and Serenity/JS.

### Command line usage

```
jasmine --reporter=@serenity-js/jasmine
```

### Programmatic usage

```typescript
import serenityReporterForJasmine = require('@serenity-js/jasmine');

jasmine.getEnv().addReporter(serenityReporterForJasmine);
```
